title: Obama's Oregon visit sparks protests
text:
Obama's Oregon visit sparks protests Wall Street Journal reports 2 separate demonstrations could attract thousands of supporters UPDATED 1:31 PM CDT Oct 09, 2015 Photos Olivier Douliery-Pool/Getty Images 
President Barack Obama is making the trip to Oregon to meet with families of victims of the Umpqua Community College shooting, but not everyone in the small lumbering community say the president is welcome. Online writings on guns linked to shooter's mom 
The apparent online writings of the mother of the man who killed nine people at a community college in Oregon discuss guns and the autism spectrum, painting a partial picture of the environment the family lived in, their beliefs and the challenges th... Obama: We're the only country with... 
According to a Los Angeles Times report, some residents accuse Obama of using the Oct. 1 shooting as means to justify tighter gun control laws, and they plan to protest Friday. 
The president appeared and sounded frustrated during a press conference after the shooting that killed nine people, saying there is the lack of progress on gun control laws and that there is little executive action he can take on the issue. 
The Wall Street Journal reports that two separate demonstrations organized via Facebook have attracted thousands of supporters. 
And gun rights advocates say they are planning an armed protest for Obama's visit, NBC News reports.
